result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Miller

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Miller not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Anthony Miller.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea and Sentencing. 
Defense request an adjournment advising the court she is missing some discovery.
State will follow up. Defense request a bail bond hearing.Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Angel L Johnson in court, defendant Anthony Miller not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requests a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Angel L Johnson in court, defendant Anthony Miller not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are having issues viewing discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $3,500. Defendant to maintian a stable residence with defendant's mother. Defendant is ot obey curfew, curfew is from 5:30 pm to 7:30 am with release for legal appointments, medical appointments and school.

Attorney Angel L Johnson in court, defendant Anthony Miller not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Bail motion by defense argued and GRANTED by the Court. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Request for Bail Reduction

Defendant Anthony Miller in court with Attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Anthony Miller in custody.  ADA Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer A. Schein. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Next date provided by the clerk in Br. 45.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Court ordered no contact with Austin C. and  Caroline L.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $15,000. If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and no GPS.

Defendant Anthony Miller in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Anthony Miller in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Miller appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
